US jury finds BNP Paribas liable for complicity in Sudan atrocities
subhead: The French bank is accused of contributing to atrocities committed under the regime of Omar al-Bashir. The plaintiffs told the federal court in Manhattan that they had been tortured, burnt with cigarettes, slashed with a knife and, in the case of the woman, sexually assaulted.

title: Woman on trial in Paris over murder of 12-year-old girl
subhead: Dahbia Benkired, 27, is accused of the murder, rape, and torture of a girl identified as Lola. The case sparked intense controversy in France, as the young Algerian woman was under a deportation order.

title: LVMH will open two extensive Tiffany stores in Paris
subhead: To boost dwindling sales, the luxury group plans to open a 2,100-square-meter store for the New York jeweler in 2028, next to its main rival, Cartier.

subhead: Vincent Lemire accompanied the French delegation to the summit in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt. 'The gaps in Trump's plan must be filled with the French-Saudi plan,' he writes.

title: Taxing the super-rich? The 'Zucman tax' explained
subhead: A proposal to tax the super-rich by a French economist called Gabriel Zucman has taken center stage in debates about France's budget as Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu tries to stifle another governmental crisis.
byline: Allison Zarouri,  Félix Pommier and  Sinead McCausland

title: First Wap, a discreet cyber-surveillance firm tracking journalists, public figures and corporate executives
subhead: Little known to the public, this long-standing player in the surveillance industry has been selling phone-tracking technology for more than 20 years, including to authoritarian regimes. Among its targets: a journalist investigating the Vatican, an Airbus employee, and Hollywood actor Jared Leto.
